header.headertext: AMENDMENTS TO BE MOVED IN GRAND COMMITTEE

text.quote: 000: After Clause 78, insert the following new Clause—
text.IndentOne: In Schedule 1 to the Children Act 2004, in paragraph 1 (status) after sub-paragraph (2) insert—
text.quote: “(3) The Secretary of State shall not undermine the Children’s Commissioner’s independence and shall ensure that the Children’s Commissioner is under as few constraints as reasonably possible in determining—
000: Schedule 5, page 188, line 9, at end insert—
“(1A) The Secretary of State shall appoint an individual only if the Secretary of State reasonably considers the individual—
text.IndentOne: (a) has adequate experience and knowledge relating to children’s rights, including the involvement of children in decision-making; and
(b) is able and willing to act independently of Government.”.”

text.quote: 000: Schedule 5, page 188, line 14, at end insert—
text.IndentTwo: “(8) The Secretary of State shall have due regard to the views of any parliamentary committee which has published a view on a proposed appointment or removal from office of the Children’s Commissioner.”.”
